intro: Trisetopsis rogerellisii, commonly known as the Rogerell's trisetopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
